**Â«As you name the ship, so shall it sailÂ»: the founder of WEB3 speaks out**

Next comes the first-person story from the one without whom there would be neither this channel nor the entire ecosystem: Domainer.

ğŸ‘‹ I didnâ€™t catch the golden era of Web 2.0, when domainers were making fortunes selling names. But as I studied the market, I realized one thing: __the key is to see opportunities and not be afraid to jump in when the window opens.__ For me, that window was TON DNS. When I first discovered .ton domains, I saw the same unique chances I had once missed in Web 2.0. It became clear: the next big market would be domaining in Web 3.0.

ğŸ‘ Immersing myself in TON DNS, I began acquiring .ton domains en masse. It was then that I took the pseudonym Domainer, securing the matching domain and username.

ğŸª™ **Over the years of promoting projects I learned for sure:** a name isnâ€™t a detail, itâ€™s a foundation. It can open doors or close them. Thatâ€™s why, for our utility token, I chose a strong and symbolic name â€” WEB3. Thanks to our rapid rise and results in the Open League, people started talking about us, and the name became tied to our entire ecosystem. Thatâ€™s how we evolved from TON DNS Club to WEB3.
